results.firPara: Manager is confident his battle-hardened team inspired by Gareth Bale can reach the Euro 2016 final with the right game plan against experienced opponents
results.secPara: These are intoxicating days for Christopher Patrick Coleman. Having masterminded Waless progress to a historic Euro 2016 semi-final against Portugal in Lyon on Wednesday, he can now be linked with the England managers job. Let it be said Coleman has arrived.
results.webTitle: Clear-eyed Chris Coleman plots the course to take Wales past Portugal

results.firPara: This was France serving notice of their quality. A team who had rather huffed and puffed up to now, scraping through late in contests they had been expected to win at a canter, rediscovered their rhythm in the drizzle of Saint-Denis to cast Iceland from the tournament. Their opponents have provided one of the most refreshing and uplifting stories of these finals, the fans Viking chant still echoing defiantly around the arena long after the final whistle, but the natural order has been restored. In the end the smallest nation ever to grace a major finals endured their fairytale being trampled underfoot by a true contender.
results.secPara: Didier Deschamps could survey the scene with satisfaction from his dugout, substituting those players who had been flirting with suspension long before the end and even forgiving the odd pang of defensive frailty exposed after the interval. There is an acceptance those errors will have to be eradicated on Thursday. Germany await in Marseille, a tête-à-tête which usually brings the French out in a cold sweat when it comes to major finals. Memories drift to Seville in 1982, Guadalajara in 1986, even the Maracana in 2014, when Les Bleus have been defeated by foes whom they have not defeated in a competitive game for 58 years. Confident? No, said Olivier Giroud. The Germans are world champions and favourites. But we want to write a new chapter in the history of French football.
results.webTitle: France coast past Iceland and into Euro 2016 semi-final

results.firPara: Icelands fairytale came to an end as France cruised into a semi-final against Germany with a blistering first-half performance
results.secPara: Icelands fairytale came to an end as France cruised into a semi-final against Germany with a blistering first-half performance
results.webTitle: France 5-2 Iceland: Euro 2016 quarter-final – as it happened

results.firPara: Wales go into the biggest game in their football history without two key players. Is it time for a new disciplinary system?
results.secPara: Chris Coleman did his best to sound diplomatic. Its disappointing but rules are rules, the Wales manager said.
results.webTitle: Wales plight proves a cautionary tale for Uefa’s harsh new rule change | Daniel Taylor

results.firPara: After the hoopla of Pep Guardiolas introduction to Manchester City, the Catalan was frank about the need to adapt if required. Guardiola is the 45-year-old coach who has accrued 22 trophies in nine outstanding seasons. The man whose Lionel Messi‑led Barcelona claimed two Champions League titles and reinvented the game with a brand of dizzying carousel-passing between 2008-12. Yet he also understands the need for flexibility regarding the way City may play under him.
results.secPara: Guardiola appeared a touch uncomfortable at the Cityzens Weekend event on Sunday, in which he was hailed as a football deity as City understandably made the most of his first meeting with the clubs fans. Instantly, though, it was down to business as Guardiola spoke of how he changed tack in 2013 when arriving in the Bundesliga following a years sabbatical.
results.webTitle: Pep Guardiola ready to adapt again in the reshaping of Manchester City

results.firPara: It took only two games for Fernando Santos to declare his confidence. The Portugal manager had just witnessed the draw against Austria and surprised everybody by saying he would not be home until 11 July. And there will be a huge party waiting for me, he said.
results.secPara: Portugal are yet to win in 90 minutes at Euro 2016 but his prediction is one game from coming true. Criticism remains prevalent because their general play has lacked beauty, but Santos is cool with it as they keep progressing.
results.webTitle: Portugal focus on getting the Euro 2016 job done in any way they can

results.firPara: Once all this is finally over, Icelands central defenders will pair off and make sense of what has happened in their own way. Last summer Kari Arnason and Ragnar Sigurdsson went travelling in Thailand together; this year they will settle for something closer to home and the plan is already in place. Ragi and I have already talked about it, Arnason says. Well go to a golf course in Iceland – just go straight there and try to play as much golf as we can.
results.secPara: It is a simple enough ambition, especially when set against the kaleidoscopic vision Iceland are realising this summer. The mini-golf green in the immaculate gardens of their team hotel, Les Tresoms, offers ample opportunity to develop their short game but Arnason, sitting on the adjacent patio under a scorching sun, knows significant diversions can wait.
results.webTitle: Iceland in confident mood and looking to put golfing holidays on hold

results.firPara: • I have to hug them, kick their arse, says Guardiola of City players
results.secPara: • I have to hug them, kick their arse, says Guardiola of City players
results.webTitle: Pep Guardiola says he will ‘kick arse’ after Manchester City unveiling

results.firPara: European commission inquiry has considered whether Spain broke rules on public funding through tax breaks
results.secPara: The European commission is expected to deliver its verdict on Monday on whether Spain wrongfully handed out tens of millions of euros in state aid to some of the countrys top football clubs.
results.webTitle: Brussels set to give verdict on 'unlawful' aid to Spanish football clubs

results.firPara: Pep Guardiola spoke for the first time since officially starting as Manchester City manager, revealing some ways he will work at the Etihad Stadium.
results.secPara: And that will do you for today. Pep Guardiola, new Manchester City manager, has spoken. He will no doubt speak more in the coming days. And then do some managing. The latter bit cant come soon enough.
results.webTitle: Pep Guardiola unveiled to Manchester City fans – as it happened
